# Support

Thanks for using Docker Server Blockchain! Here's how to get help.

## Documentation

Before seeking help, please check our documentation:

- [README.md](../README.md) - Quick start and overview
- [docs/ARCHITECTURE.md](../docs/ARCHITECTURE.md) - System architecture
- [docs/CONFIGURATION.md](../docs/CONFIGURATION.md) - Configuration options
- [docs/COOLIFY.md](../docs/COOLIFY.md) - Coolify deployment guide
- [docs/AIO.md](../docs/AIO.md) - All-in-One image guide
- [docs/LIGHTNING.md](../docs/LIGHTNING.md) - Lightning Network setup
- [docs/TROUBLESHOOTING.md](../docs/TROUBLESHOOTING.md) - Common issues

## Getting Help

### GitHub Issues

For bug reports, feature requests, and questions:
- Search [existing issues](https://github.com/host-uk/docker-server-blockchain/issues) first
- Use the appropriate [issue template](https://github.com/host-uk/docker-server-blockchain/issues/new/choose)

### BTCPay Server Community

For BTCPay Server-specific questions:
- [BTCPay Server Docs](https://docs.btcpayserver.org/)
- [BTCPay Server Mattermost](https://chat.btcpayserver.org/)
- [BTCPay Server GitHub](https://github.com/btcpayserver/btcpayserver)

### Bitcoin Core

For Bitcoin Core-specific questions:
- [Bitcoin Core Docs](https://developer.bitcoin.org/)
- [Bitcoin Stack Exchange](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/)

## What to Include When Asking for Help

1. **Environment details**
   - Operating system and version
   - Docker and Docker Compose versions
   - Deployment method (Compose, Coolify, AIO)

2. **Configuration** (remove sensitive data!)
   - Relevant environment variables
   - Compose file customizations

3. **Logs**
   - `docker compose logs <service>`
   - Error messages

4. **Steps to reproduce**
   - What you did
   - What you expected
   - What actually happened

## Response Times

This is an open source project maintained by volunteers. Response times may vary.
We appreciate your patience and understanding.

## Security Issues

For security vulnerabilities, please see [SECURITY.md](../SECURITY.md).
**Do not** open public issues for security concerns.
